text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Tuesday: NEUE ZUERCHER ZEITUNG - Swiss economics minister Jean-Pascal Delamuraz and Philippine President Fidel Ramos signed a bilateral agreement in Manila to promote investment. - Schweizerische Radio Gesellschaft posted a profit of 20 million Swiss francs for 1996 compared to 49 million in 1995. Cash flow fell to 80.6 million francs from 141.7 million. - Swiss exports of animal meal more than tripled to a total 17,903 tonnes in 1996. - The Swiss canton of Thurgau told the federal government it no longer wants to accept any asylum-seeking Kosovo Albanians. - The Italian-speaking canton of Ticino is preparing itself for a possible bombardment of Albanian refugees coming in from Italy. TAGES ANZEIGER - Swiss Re is selling its Societe Anonyme Francaise de Reassurances (SAFR) unit to Bermuda-based PartnerRe. - Swiss economics minister Jean-Pascal Delamuraz and a four-member delegation will visit India for two days this week. JOURNAL DE GENEVE - The University of Geneva plans to become the first univerity to offer post-graduate studies in humanitarian action. It expects to begin offering the programme in the fall of 1998. -- Zurich Editorial +41 1 631 7340
